result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
12-04-15/ Judge Dennis R Cimpl
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two;  and consecutive to 14CM4308 and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 223 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with Jennifer G. or her family.   If defendant has any contact with the victim, Court orders defendant reimprisoned.
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.  No possessin of drug paraphernalia.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  Restitution in the amount of $400.00 to Jennifer G. and $400.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Pay DNA surcharges on count two only. Court waived DNA surcharge on count one due to imposition of DNA surcharge on count two.
Pay all court costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail posted on 14CM4308 to apply first to restitution to the victim, restitution to the State and court costs.
ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one; and consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 223 days.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-04-15 Court order; Def not eligible for Wis SAP
Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify eligibility for substance abuse program.
Original Transcript (58 pages) commencing 10/30/2015 SENTENCING received and filed.
Restitution Check Packet

Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Jennifer G.

As to Count 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS CONCURRENT to Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to 14CM4308 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS CONCURRENT to Count 1 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court grants 223 days credit.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and is ELIGIBLE the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- no contact with Jennifer G. or her family.  If defendant has any contact with the victim Court orders defendant re-imprisoned
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Batterer's Intervention Counseling
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $400.00 to Jennifer G. and $400.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation Program
Pay DNA surcharges on Count 2 only, Court waives DNA surcharges on Count 1 due to imposition of DNA surcharges on Count 2;
Pay all court costs;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail posted on 14CM4308 to apply first to restitution to the victim, restitution to the State and court costs
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Documents of support for defendant.
Pictures of victim and crime scene
Restitution Worksheet
undated from defendant, received and filed
dated 10-12-2015 from Tonya F, received and filed

Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in custody.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 1 & 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  As to Counts 3, 4 & 5:  pursuant to negotiations Court dismissed and read in the charges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State recites its final offer to the defendant on the record.  Court adjourns the case to allow the defendant more time.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS State's motion for joinder with case# 14CM4308.  Motion for Joinder received and filed. All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Victim impact statement received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense attorney is in jury trial elsewhere.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter in support of the defendant received and filed.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for Irene Parthum for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for plea and sentencing on 06/10/2015 at 8:30am.

Filed: Documentation in Support of the Defendant
At the request of the defense a bail review is scheduled for 05/18/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.  District attorney office notified.
Letter from defendant received and filed.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in custody. Ronald Dague on behalf of Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JG, SK, JK, DN, 6880 or 6882 S Rolling Meadows Ct, 901 15th Ave.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETYto be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jeremy Douglas Jaaffar in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Counts 3, 4, and 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
